workflow.name: Generate Monthly Financial Reports with Gemini AI, SQL, and Outlook
workflow.description:
# üöÄ AI-Powered Business Performance Reporting Automation

**Unlock executive-level insights with ZERO manual work!**  
This n8n template empowers you to automate your entire monthly business performance reporting using dynamic SQL queries, AI-driven analysis, and beautiful HTML dashboards ‚Äî all delivered directly to your inbox.

---

## üéØ What This Automation Does

- üìÜ **Triggers automatically every month** (5th of each month)
- üßÆ **Fetches financial data** from SQL (ERPNext or any database)
- üîÅ **Loops over cost centers** to analyze each business unit individually
- üìä **Generates Profit & Loss reports**, WIP, Employee stats, and vertical breakdowns
- ü§ñ **Uses Google Gemini 2.5 AI** to perform advanced financial analysis
- üíå **Delivers a polished HTML report** to your email inbox
- üîß **Fully modular** ‚Äì replace data source with Excel, Google Sheets, or APIs

![Sample Report](https://syncbricks.com/wp-content/uploads/2025/04/report.png)  

---

## üßë‚Äçüè´ Step-by-Step Video Tutorial

üé• **Watch the full tutorial on YouTube:**  
[![Watch Tutorial](https://img.youtube.com/vi/yatQpQZLqg4/0.jpg)](https://youtu.be/yatQpQZLqg4)  
üìå *Learn how each node works and see the AI-generated report in action.*

---

## üåê Useful Links

- üîó **Sign up for n8n Cloud** (recommended for non-tech users):  
  üëâ [https://n8n.syncbricks.com](https://n8n.syncbricks.com)

- üìò **Download the step-by-step Guidebook (Free)**:  
  üëâ [https://lms.syncbricks.com/books/n8n](https://lms.syncbricks.com/books/n8n)

- üìö **Explore the full course on n8n** (includes templates, workflows, and AI integrations):  
  üëâ [https://lms.syncbricks.com/courses/n8n](https://lms.syncbricks.com/courses/n8n)

---

## üõ† Requirements

- ‚úÖ n8n (Self-hosted or Cloud)
- ‚úÖ SQL Database (MySQL / PostgreSQL / ERPNext)
- ‚úÖ Microsoft Outlook or Gmail (to send the report)
- ‚úÖ Gemini API Key (for AI analysis)
- ‚úÖ Basic understanding of your data schema

---

## üí° Why Use This Template?

- ‚è± **Saves 2-3 days of manual work every month**
- üìà **Improves financial visibility across business units**
- ü§ù **Great for CFOs, COOs, Finance Analysts, and BI teams**
- üîÑ **Scales across multiple divisions and companies**
- üß† **Leverages AI for actionable insights and recommendations**

---

## üß© Customize It Your Way

- Replace the SQL nodes with:
  - Excel / Google Sheets
  - Airtable / APIs
  - Custom Applications

- Swap the AI model:
  - OpenAI GPT
  - Claude
  - DeepSeek

- Adjust the report structure or HTML style

---

## üôå Get Started Now

üéØ Import the JSON template ‚Üí Connect your data ‚Üí Receive business insights via email.  
Don‚Äôt let manual reporting slow down your decision-making.

üëâ [Sign up for n8n Cloud](https://n8n.syncbricks.com)  
üëâ [Learn n8n with Amjid](https://www.udemy.com/course/mastering-n8n-ai-agents-api-automation-webhooks-no-code/?referralCode=0309FD70BE2D72630C09)  
üëâ [Download Guide](https://lms.syncbricks.com/books/n8n)

---

**Created by [Amjid Ali](https://amjidali.com) | SyncBricks‚Ñ¢ ‚Äì Automation for Everyone**

parameters.query:
SELECT
  --  budget_data.fiscal_year AS `Year`,
  --  budget_data.cost_center AS `Cost Center`,
    budget_data.budget_group AS `Budget Group`,
--    budget_data.sort_order AS `Sort Order`,

    -- YTD Totals up to previous month (up to dynamic month)
    SUM(budget_data.budget_amount) AS `Budget YTD`,
    SUM(COALESCE(actual_data.actual_amount, 0)) AS `Actual YTD`,
    SUM(COALESCE(actual_data.actual_amount, 0)) - SUM(budget_data.budget_amount) AS `Variance YTD`,

    -- Previous Month Totals Only
    SUM(CASE WHEN budget_data.budget_month = {{ $('PreviousMonth').item.json.previousMonth }} THEN budget_data.budget_amount ELSE 0 END) AS `Budget PM`,
    SUM(CASE WHEN budget_data.budget_month = {{ $('PreviousMonth').item.json.previousMonth }} THEN COALESCE(actual_data.actual_amount, 0) ELSE 0 END) AS `Actual PM`,
    SUM(CASE WHEN budget_data.budget_month = {{ $('PreviousMonth').item.json.previousMonth }} THEN COALESCE(actual_data.actual_amount, 0) ELSE 0 END) -
    SUM(CASE WHEN budget_data.budget_month = {{ $('PreviousMonth').item.json.previousMonth }} THEN budget_data.budget_amount ELSE 0 END) AS `Variance PM`

FROM
    (
        SELECT
            bg.budget_group_name AS budget_group,
            bg.sort_order,
            bgd.fiscal_year,
            bgd.budget_month,
            bgd.cost_center,
            CAST(bgd.budget_amount AS DECIMAL(18,6)) AS budget_amount
        FROM
            `tabBudget Group Detail` bgd
        JOIN
            `tabBudget Group` bg ON bg.name = bgd.parent
        WHERE
            bgd.fiscal_year = {{ $('PreviousMonth').item.json.year }}
            AND bgd.budget_month <= {{ $('PreviousMonth').item.json.previousMonth }}
            AND bgd.cost_center = '{{ $json.CostCenter }}'
    ) AS budget_data

LEFT JOIN (
    SELECT
        acc.budget_group AS budget_group,
        YEAR(gl.posting_date) AS fiscal_year,
        MONTH(gl.posting_date) AS budget_month,
        gl.cost_center,
        SUM(
            CASE 
                WHEN acc.root_type = 'Income' THEN gl.credit - gl.debit
                WHEN acc.root_type = 'Expense' THEN gl.debit - gl.credit
                ELSE 0
            END
        ) AS actual_amount
    FROM
        `tabGL Entry` gl
    JOIN
        `tabAccount` acc ON gl.account = acc.name
    WHERE
        acc.budget_group IS NOT NULL
        AND acc.root_type IN ('Income', 'Expense')
        AND gl.docstatus = 1
        AND YEAR(gl.posting_date) = {{ $('PreviousMonth').item.json.year }}
        AND MONTH(gl.posting_date) <= {{ $('PreviousMonth').item.json.previousMonth }}
        AND gl.cost_center = '{{ $('Filter').item.json['Cost Center'] }}'
    GROUP BY
        acc.budget_group,
        YEAR(gl.posting_date),
        MONTH(gl.posting_date),
        gl.cost_center
) AS actual_data
ON
    budget_data.budget_group = actual_data.budget_group AND
    budget_data.fiscal_year = actual_data.fiscal_year AND
    budget_data.budget_month = actual_data.budget_month AND
    budget_data.cost_center = actual_data.cost_center

GROUP BY
    budget_data.fiscal_year,
    budget_data.cost_center,
    budget_data.budget_group,
    budget_data.sort_order

ORDER BY
    budget_data.cost_center,
    budget_data.sort_order,
    budget_data.budget_group;

SELECT DISTINCT
    budget_data.cost_center AS `Cost Center`
FROM
(
    SELECT
        bgd.cost_center,
        bgd.fiscal_year,
        bgd.budget_month
    FROM
        `tabBudget Group Detail` bgd
    JOIN
        `tabBudget Group` bg ON bg.name = bgd.parent
    WHERE
        bgd.fiscal_year = {{ $json.year }}
        AND bgd.budget_month <= {{ $json.previousMonth }}
) AS budget_data

INNER JOIN
(
    SELECT DISTINCT
        gl.cost_center,
        YEAR(gl.posting_date) AS fiscal_year,
        MONTH(gl.posting_date) AS budget_month
    FROM
        `tabGL Entry` gl
    JOIN
        `tabAccount` acc ON gl.account = acc.name
    WHERE
        acc.budget_group IS NOT NULL
        AND acc.root_type IN ('Income', 'Expense')
        AND gl.docstatus = 1
        AND YEAR(gl.posting_date) = {{ $json.year }}
        AND MONTH(gl.posting_date) <= {{ $json.previousMonth }}
        AND gl.cost_center IS NOT NULL
) AS gl_data
ON
    budget_data.cost_center = gl_data.cost_center
    AND budget_data.fiscal_year = gl_data.fiscal_year
    AND budget_data.budget_month = gl_data.budget_month

ORDER BY
    budget_data.cost_center;

SELECT
   -- e.payroll_cost_center AS `Payroll Cost Center`,
    COUNT(*) AS `Total Employees`,
    COUNT(CASE WHEN YEAR(e.date_of_joining) = YEAR(CURDATE()) THEN 1 END) AS `Joined This Year`,
    COUNT(CASE WHEN YEAR(e.date_of_joining) = YEAR(CURDATE()) AND MONTH(e.date_of_joining) = MONTH(CURDATE()) THEN 1 END) AS `Joined This Month`
FROM
    `tabEmployee` e
WHERE
    e.status = 'Active'
    AND e.payroll_cost_center = '{{ $json.CostCenter }}'
GROUP BY
    e.payroll_cost_center;

parameters.text:
=You are a Business Performance Analyst Expert in Financial Management of Syncbricks LLC,  you willbe given an input to Analyze the Financial Performance of syncbricks which is an AI and Automation Company.
The sections Given to you will be below

1. Financial Overview ‚Äì YTD & PM Summary (whis is income and expense of the Company, this data doesn't include the calculation of Gross Profit and Net Profit that you must do. This should be used together in one section only don't seperate them)
2. Financial Overview ‚Äì Vertical Profit & Loss (This containers the Verticials within the Cost Center, these are in fact the Sub Business Unit, you don't need to calculate anything but the information is for analysis to see how the Verticals within the Business Unit Perfored )
3. Financial Overview ‚Äì WIP Summary (This is the Projects Summary about how many projects are currently open and work is the WIP - Work in Process of the Project, the WIP figure should be added for Profit and Loss Statement Under Proejct Reveneu as expected WIP)
4. Employees in the Business Unit (These will be the number of Employees who are directly working in this BU, which means these employees are only serving the Company, other staff which are in back office support are not included in this. )
*** Your Role ***

Your Role is to Prepare a comprehensive Report : 
1. Executive Summary : Tell how was the overall performance of the Business Unit.
2. Analayze the Financial Overview - YTD together with PM Summary (Which is Previous Month) which is previous month Income and Expenses you must use Proper Strcuture of Financial Statement with Budget Vs Actuals (follow same input already given). 

You must use the Section that will be shared with you in detail that says "Financial Overview ‚Äì YTD & PM Summary " and from there you must ensure to create sections based on best Practices of Performance Analysis that should include;

Section: Revenue
-Projects - Revenue
-Trading - Revenue
-Service - Revenue
Net Sales (Total)
Section: Project Work in Process
WIP (Revenue to Book)
Total: Gross Sale
Section: Cost of Sale
Projects - COGS
Trading - COGS
Service - COGS
Total Cost of Sales
Gross Profit
Other Income
Gross Income

Section: Indirect Cost (here you must all the detail of expenses from "Financial Overview ‚Äì YTD & PM Summary"
Then you must calculate
Profit / (Loss) before tax
NP % to Revenue

Use the calculator tool to ensure precise calculations.


- Don't add decimals give format in currency but don't add symbol.
Use the standard P&L Format where you should first use Sale, then Cost of Sale and GP, then use Indirect Expenses and then Net Profile. Ensure to calculate the Perentages as well.
3. Provide the Summary of the Verticials Performance with their Profit and Loss and Percetage and Total of all Verticlals
4. Current Project Progress.
5. Employees Summary, Number of Employees, How many joined in this Year and what is per Eployee Revenue and Gross Profit 

Analyze Overall Performance of the Company and provide the Business Managers an Overview of what should be done next. Calculate per employee profit as well and suggest what is the performance overall

**Tools**
Use calculator tool to do all calculations for accurate calculations

** Formatting and Output **

Give output in html format fully responsive in with beauty added using CSS,  ready to be shared with all possible tables, in hightly attracrtive format, headings, add colors green for good, red for bad, organge for acceptable and so on, also add remarks to show how the performance was, enusre to response as if you were as an Expert in Analyzing the Bususiness Performance. Don't add any other infomration or symbols which are not part of html. Don't give additional message saying ok, I will do and so on.
Align Text in table on left and numbers on right
Number formatting : ##,###


Here is the data

Month : {{ $('PreviousMonth').first().json.previousMonth }}
Year  : {{ $('PreviousMonth').first().json.year }}

{{ $json.html }}

parameters.query:
SELECT
   -- gl.vertical AS `Vertical`,

    -- Total Income (based on root_type)
    ROUND(SUM(CASE WHEN acc.root_type = 'Income' THEN gl.credit - gl.debit ELSE 0 END), 0) AS `Total Income`,

    -- Total Expenses (based on root_type)
    ROUND(SUM(CASE WHEN acc.root_type = 'Expense' THEN gl.debit - gl.credit ELSE 0 END), 0) AS `Total Expenses`,

    -- Profit or Loss = Income - Expenses
    ROUND(SUM(
        CASE 
            WHEN acc.root_type = 'Income' THEN gl.credit - gl.debit
            WHEN acc.root_type = 'Expense' THEN -1 * (gl.debit - gl.credit)
            ELSE 0
        END
    ), 0) AS `Profit or Loss`

FROM
    `tabGL Entry` gl
JOIN
    `tabAccount` acc ON gl.account = acc.name

WHERE
    acc.root_type IN ('Income', 'Expense')
    AND gl.docstatus = 1
    AND gl.cost_center = '{{ $("Selected Cost Center").item.json.CostCenter }}'
    AND MONTH(gl.posting_date) = {{ $("Selected Cost Center").item.json.previousMonth }}
    AND YEAR(gl.posting_date) = {{ $("Selected Cost Center").item.json.year }}

GROUP BY
    gl.vertical

SELECT
   -- p.cost_center AS `Cost Center`,
    COUNT(DISTINCT p.name) AS `Projects`,

    FORMAT(SUM(p.contract_value), 0) AS `Contract Value`,
    FORMAT(SUM(p.total_opening_revenue), 0) AS `Opening Revenue`,
    FORMAT(SUM(p.total_opening_cost), 0) AS `Opening Cost`,

    -- New Revenue (GL)
    IFNULL((
        SELECT SUM(gl.credit - gl.debit)
        FROM `tabGL Entry` gl
        JOIN `tabAccount` acc ON acc.name = gl.account
        WHERE gl.docstatus = 1 AND acc.root_type = 'Income' AND acc.is_group = 0
          AND gl.project IN (SELECT name FROM `tabProject` WHERE cost_center = p.cost_center AND status = 'Open')
          AND gl.posting_date <= LAST_DAY(CURDATE() - INTERVAL 1 MONTH)
    ), 0) AS `New Revenue`,

    -- New Cost (GL)
    IFNULL((
        SELECT SUM(gl.debit - gl.credit)
        FROM `tabGL Entry` gl
        JOIN `tabAccount` acc ON acc.name = gl.account
        WHERE gl.docstatus = 1 AND acc.root_type = 'Expense' AND acc.is_group = 0
          AND gl.project IN (SELECT name FROM `tabProject` WHERE cost_center = p.cost_center AND status = 'Open')
          AND gl.posting_date <= LAST_DAY(CURDATE() - INTERVAL 1 MONTH)
    ), 0) AS `New Cost`,

    -- Actual Revenue
    FORMAT(
        SUM(p.total_opening_revenue) +
        IFNULL((
            SELECT SUM(gl.credit - gl.debit)
            FROM `tabGL Entry` gl
            JOIN `tabAccount` acc ON acc.name = gl.account
            WHERE gl.docstatus = 1 AND acc.root_type = 'Income' AND acc.is_group = 0
              AND gl.project IN (SELECT name FROM `tabProject` WHERE cost_center = p.cost_center AND status = 'Open')
              AND gl.posting_date <= LAST_DAY(CURDATE() - INTERVAL 1 MONTH)
        ), 0), 0
    ) AS `Actual Revenue`,

    -- Actual Cost
    FORMAT(
        SUM(p.total_opening_cost) +
        IFNULL((
            SELECT SUM(gl.debit - gl.credit)
            FROM `tabGL Entry` gl
            JOIN `tabAccount` acc ON acc.name = gl.account
            WHERE gl.docstatus = 1 AND acc.root_type = 'Expense' AND acc.is_group = 0
              AND gl.project IN (SELECT name FROM `tabProject` WHERE cost_center = p.cost_center AND status = 'Open')
              AND gl.posting_date <= LAST_DAY(CURDATE() - INTERVAL 1 MONTH)
        ), 0), 0
    ) AS `Actual Cost`,

    -- Invoice %
    CONCAT(ROUND((
        (
            SUM(p.total_opening_revenue) +
            IFNULL((
                SELECT SUM(gl.credit - gl.debit)
                FROM `tabGL Entry` gl
                JOIN `tabAccount` acc ON acc.name = gl.account
                WHERE gl.docstatus = 1 AND acc.root_type = 'Income' AND acc.is_group = 0
                  AND gl.project IN (SELECT name FROM `tabProject` WHERE cost_center = p.cost_center AND status = 'Open')
                  AND gl.posting_date <= LAST_DAY(CURDATE() - INTERVAL 1 MONTH)
            ), 0)
        ) / NULLIF(SUM(p.contract_value), 0) * 100
    ), 0), '%') AS `Invoice %`,

    -- Cost %
    CONCAT(ROUND((
        (
            SUM(p.total_opening_cost) +
            IFNULL((
                SELECT SUM(gl.debit - gl.credit)
                FROM `tabGL Entry` gl
                JOIN `tabAccount` acc ON acc.name = gl.account
                WHERE gl.docstatus = 1 AND acc.root_type = 'Expense' AND acc.is_group = 0
                  AND gl.project IN (SELECT name FROM `tabProject` WHERE cost_center = p.cost_center AND status = 'Open')
                  AND gl.posting_date <= LAST_DAY(CURDATE() - INTERVAL 1 MONTH)
            ), 0)
        ) / NULLIF(SUM(p.budgeted_project_cost), 0) * 100
    ), 0), '%') AS `Cost %`,

    -- WIP Calculation
    FORMAT(
        CASE
            WHEN SUM(p.budgeted_project_cost) = 0 THEN 0
            WHEN (
                SUM(p.total_opening_cost) +
                IFNULL((
                    SELECT SUM(gl.debit - gl.credit)
                    FROM `tabGL Entry` gl
                    JOIN `tabAccount` acc ON acc.name = gl.account
                    WHERE gl.docstatus = 1 AND acc.root_type = 'Expense' AND acc.is_group = 0
                      AND gl.project IN (SELECT name FROM `tabProject` WHERE cost_center = p.cost_center AND status = 'Open')
                      AND gl.posting_date <= LAST_DAY(CURDATE() - INTERVAL 1 MONTH)
                ), 0)
            ) > SUM(p.budgeted_project_cost)
            THEN
                SUM(p.contract_value) -
                (SUM(p.total_opening_revenue) +
                IFNULL((
                    SELECT SUM(gl.credit - gl.debit)
                    FROM `tabGL Entry` gl
                    JOIN `tabAccount` acc ON acc.name = gl.account
                    WHERE gl.docstatus = 1 AND acc.root_type = 'Income' AND acc.is_group = 0
                      AND gl.project IN (SELECT name FROM `tabProject` WHERE cost_center = p.cost_center AND status = 'Open')
                      AND gl.posting_date <= LAST_DAY(CURDATE() - INTERVAL 1 MONTH)
                ), 0))
            ELSE
                (SUM(p.contract_value) * (
                    (SUM(p.total_opening_cost) +
                    IFNULL((
                        SELECT SUM(gl.debit - gl.credit)
                        FROM `tabGL Entry` gl
                        JOIN `tabAccount` acc ON acc.name = gl.account
                        WHERE gl.docstatus = 1 AND acc.root_type = 'Expense' AND acc.is_group = 0
                          AND gl.project IN (SELECT name FROM `tabProject` WHERE cost_center = p.cost_center AND status = 'Open')
                          AND gl.posting_date <= LAST_DAY(CURDATE() - INTERVAL 1 MONTH)
                    ), 0)) / NULLIF(SUM(p.budgeted_project_cost), 0)
                )) -
                (SUM(p.total_opening_revenue) +
                IFNULL((
                    SELECT SUM(gl.credit - gl.debit)
                    FROM `tabGL Entry` gl
                    JOIN `tabAccount` acc ON acc.name = gl.account
                    WHERE gl.docstatus = 1 AND acc.root_type = 'Income' AND acc.is_group = 0
                      AND gl.project IN (SELECT name FROM `tabProject` WHERE cost_center = p.cost_center AND status = 'Open')
                      AND gl.posting_date <= LAST_DAY(CURDATE() - INTERVAL 1 MONTH)
                ), 0))
        END,
    0) AS `WIP`

FROM
    `tabProject` p
WHERE
    p.cost_center = '{{ $json.CostCenter }}'
    AND p.status = 'Open'
GROUP BY
    p.cost_center;

parameters.content:
## Key Sections of n8n Workflow

**üü¢ Schedule Trigger**
- Triggers the automation on the 5th of every month.
- Sets the cadence for monthly reporting.

**üìÖ Date & Time + üßÆ PreviousMonth**
- Captures the current date and derives the previous month/year for dynamic filtering.
- Used throughout all SQL queries for monthly slicing.

**üìä Get Cost Centers with Budgets**
- Dynamically fetches all cost centers that have relevant budget and GL data for the selected period.
- Ensures only active, relevant divisions are processed.

**üîç Filter**
- Narrows the analysis to a specific Cost Center (e.g., "AI DEPARTMENT") during testing or preview.

**üîÅ Loop Over Items**
- Iterates over all fetched Cost Centers to individually generate reports for each business unit.
- Powers multi-division reporting automation.

**üßæ YTD vs Previous Month1**
- Performs detailed financial comparison between Year-To-Date and Previous Month.
- Outputs revenue, expenses, and variance figures.

**üè¢ Departments + üß± verticalPL**
- Analyzes financial performance by sub-divisions (Verticals) within the cost center.
- Data is transformed into an HTML table for final report.

**üß± Projects + üßÆ WIP1**
- Gathers project status and WIP metrics.
- Calculates % invoiced, cost % used, and revenue recognition stats.

**üë• Employees + üìä Employees1**
- Counts total employees, joined this month/year for the selected cost center.
- Used to calculate per-employee KPIs.

**üîó Merge + üßæ Code**
- Combines all HTML tables into a single responsive report with visual formatting.
- Clean, structured layout for email and review.

**üí° Business Performance AI Agent (Analyst)**
- Uses Google Gemini 2.5 Pro to analyze financial HTML output.
- Executes structured analysis and generates business insights, executive summary, profitability, and recommendations.

**üì© Email Data + Microsoft Outlook**
- Sends the final HTML report via email.
- Ready for business manager distribution with personalized message.

**‚è≥ Wait**
- Enables looping and batch control across multiple cost centers.
- Prevents overloading or email spamming.

**üß† Think + Calculator**
- Used by the AI Agent to "reason" and perform precise financial computations.
- Ensures accuracy in gross/net profit, percentages, and insights.

## SQL Query Nodes 
(e.g., YTD vs Previous Month, Projects, Employees, Departments)
These nodes fetch structured financial data (like revenue, expenses, WIP, employee count) directly from your database (e.g., ERPNext on MySQL).

You can use any database (MySQL, PostgreSQL, MSSQL, etc.) as long as the schema is mapped accordingly.

To generate these queries faster, use ChatGPT or any AI chat tool:
üëâ Just describe what you want (e.g., ‚Äúmonthly budget vs actual grouped by cost center‚Äù), and it will write SQL for you.

You can also replace these SQL nodes with any other data source:

Excel/CSV File (via Google Drive or n8n Read Binary File)

Google Sheets

Airtable

REST APIs

Internal apps

‚úÖ The key is to produce the same structured data format expected by the next steps in the workflow.

## Developed by Amjid Ali

Thank you for using this workflow template. It has taken me countless hours of hard work, research, and dedication to develop, and I sincerely hope it adds value to your work.

If you find this template helpful, I kindly ask you to consider supporting my efforts. Your support will help me continue improving and creating more valuable resources.

You can contribute via PayPal here:

http://paypal.me/pmptraining

For Full Course about ERPNext or Automation using AI follow below link

http://lms.syncbricks.com

Additionally, when sharing this template, I would greatly appreciate it if you include my original information to ensure proper credit is given.

Thank you for your generosity and support!
Email : amjid@amjidali.com
https://linkedin.com/in/amjidali
https://syncbricks.com
https://youtube.com/@syncbricks

user.name: Amjid Ali
user.bio: **Amjid Ali** is an automation expert and AI enthusiast specializing in creating intelligent workflows using low-code platforms like **n8n**. With a passion for simplifying complex processes, he designs solutions that enhance productivity and streamline operations. As an active contributor to the **n8n Creator Hub**, Amjid shares innovative use cases, practical templates, and best practices, empowering the community to unlock the full potential of workflow automation.

data.details: The Code node allows you to execute JavaScript in your workflow.

The Filter node can be used to filter items based on a condition. If the condition is met, the item will be passed on to the next node. If the condition is not met, the item will be omitted. Conditions can be combined together by AND(meet all conditions), or OR(meet at least one condition).
